channel.title: Question about making a server
channel.description: I have looked at about 10 tuts on how to make a server. Every one tells you to do the same thing. Get no-ip and then port forward. But they dont tell you what to do after that. I downloaded no-ip and i did the steps for that. I also port forwarded now i just need to know what to do now? any help please?

item.title: Question about making a server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“proud2bpunk, post:7, topic:541050”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=659919.msg4412703#msg4412703 date=1394417519]

I have no clue what file to look in though… I tryed setting.java and player.java and a few other file but nothing shows up when i search for what you told me. im useing Rune-evo v3 and foxtrot 718 client if that changes anything.

I was just playing with Rune-Evo v3.
First off, it’s garbage, I don’t know why Fox keeps releasing them because he says “All bugs fixed” and then I login and there is 300 more bugs to patch from his last “update”.
Second, you want to change the IP Address Client sided. I believe it’s either in Loader.java or some ClientSettings.java file.
It should say “127.0.0.1” (with quotes) you’re going to want to change it based on who will be using the client. If it’s people that are not on your local network, you want the IP to be your no-ip (if that’s what you’re using and the no-ip DUC client is running). If they are on the same network as you, you want your local ip, it’s found in your network and settings center (or similar), usually is 192.168.xxx.xxx. If it’s you, playing on the same computer as the server is being hosted from, keep it at 127.0.0.1, or localhost.
[/quote]

Thanks for the help! For some reason I couldnt get my no ip to work… I tried the number ip and the client wouldnt load… then I tried the host name and that didnt work so right now im just useing hamachi. Intell I find a way to use like a vps or a dedicated server[/quote]
Make sure your router is portforwarded on port 43594, and that the ip that is ported is equal to the one you’re hosting your computer on. Some routers will renew your ip address every week or so, so it’s smart to make your local-ip static.
Use this website to check if you properly port forwarded after your server is up and running.
Some other links that may be of help:
http://portforward.com/ Should have all guides to port forwarding
http://www.simpleportforwarding.com/ A simple to use port forwarding tool (I used to use this)
http://www.wikihow.com/Configure-a-Static-Internet-Protocol-(IP)-Address-on-a-Computer Was wrote for windows XP but it’s very similar to windows 7 (in some ways) - how to set a static ip
http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/19249/how-to-assign-a-static-ip-address-in-xp-vista-or-windows-7/ Another static ip guide (this one looks a lot more current)

Read full topic

item.title: Question about making a server
item.dc:creator: @proud2bpunk proud2bpunk
item.description:
@proud2bpunk wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:541050”][quote author=proud2bpunk link=topic=659919.msg4412630#msg4412630 date=1394397614]
I have no clue what file to look in though… I tryed setting.java and player.java and a few other file but nothing shows up when i search for what you told me. im useing Rune-evo v3 and foxtrot 718 client if that changes anything.
[/quote]
I was just playing with Rune-Evo v3.
First off, it’s garbage, I don’t know why Fox keeps releasing them because he says “All bugs fixed” and then I login and there is 300 more bugs to patch from his last “update”.
Second, you want to change the IP Address Client sided. I believe it’s either in Loader.java or some ClientSettings.java file.
It should say “127.0.0.1” (with quotes) you’re going to want to change it based on who will be using the client. If it’s people that are not on your local network, you want the IP to be your no-ip (if that’s what you’re using and the no-ip DUC client is running). If they are on the same network as you, you want your local ip, it’s found in your network and settings center (or similar), usually is 192.168.xxx.xxx. If it’s you, playing on the same computer as the server is being hosted from, keep it at 127.0.0.1, or localhost.[/quote]

Thanks for the help! For some reason I couldnt get my no ip to work… I tried the number ip and the client wouldnt load… then I tried the host name and that didnt work so right now im just useing hamachi. Intell I find a way to use like a vps or a dedicated server

Read full topic

item.title: Question about making a server
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Search for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 in your files then change it, recompile and distribute.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @proud2bpunk proud2bpunk
item.description:
@proud2bpunk wrote:

I have the foxtrot 718 client where do i add or change the ip so they can connect… i dont remember

item.title: Question about making a server
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You distribute your client and let others connect, you also try to develop your server further.

Read full topic
